activities: Whenever personal information is transferred from the EU/EEA or Switzerland to ACTON in the United States, ACTON functions as a Processor on Behalf of its Clients.  In this capacity, ACTON neither owns the data nor controls the data, but strictly acts upon the instructions of its clients.
eucountries: Austria, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Switzerland, United Kingdom
industrysector: Financial Services - (FNS)General Consumer Goods - (GCG)Insurance Services - (INS)Telecommunications Services - (TES)
personaldata: Acton processes both business and consumer data. All of the information has been compiled legally through various public sources and online data feeds. Acton does not perform any manual processing of the data.
recoursemech:
Enforcement
Individuals who wish to file a complaint or who take issue with ACTON’s Safe Harbor policies should contact ACTON’s consumer advocate at the above below. ACTON’s consumer advocate will explain the process to be followed when filing a complaint. Filing a complaint in English will expedite the process.

ACTON International 
Box 5266 Lincoln, NE 68505 
Phone: 402-742-2820 
Email: info@acton.com 
Website: www.acton.com

ACTON has registered under the Direct Marketing Association’s safe harbor complaint resolution process. If consumers can’t resolve a complaint after contacting ACTON’s consumer advocate, they may file a written complaint with the Direct Marketing Association (DMA):

The Direct Marketing Association
Attn: Ethics/Consumer Affairs Department
1111 19th Street NW
Suite 1100
Washington, DC 20036
safeharbor@the-dma.org
www.the-dma.org

ACTON is also subject to the jurisdiction of the U.S. Federal Trade Commission. Consumers unable to resolve a complaint through The Direct Marketing Association’s Safe Harbor Complaint process may contact the Federal Trade Commission:

Federal Trade Commission
Attn: Consumer Response Center
600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW
Washington, DC 20580
consumerline@ftc.gov
www.ftc.gov

ACTON agrees to cooperate with local EU and Swiss regulatory and legal authorities to resolve an ACTON associate’s dispute concerning human resources data and an alleged breach of the Safe Harbor principles.
